Sort Selectable Values in the Feature Filtering Widget

If your product catalog includes numerous filterable specs and spec values, the Feature Filtering widget can quickly fill up with options. To help ensure that the buyer's experience remains intuitive and clutter-free, organize the selectable filter values by specific criteria.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

Let’s say that the Product List page shows a list of products that have the Grade spec applied.

Three products in the list have the value Commercial for the Grade spec
One product in the list has the value Personal for the Grade spec
Two products in the list have the value Residential for the Grade spec

You can sort these values in the following ways:

Alphabetical order (default)—Commercial, Personal, Residential
Reverse alphabetical order—Residential, Personal, Commercial
By number of matching results, from least to most (ascending order)—Personal (1), Residential (2), Commercial (3).
By number of matching results, from most to least (descending order)—Commercial (3), Residential (2), Personal (1).
TIP
Sort behavior applies only to specs where Filter Type is Checkbox, and not to specs where Filter Type is Slider.
To control how the specs—and not their values—sort in the Feature Filtering widget, enter Sequence values for each of your spec records.

To configure the sort behavior that you want, update your storefront configuration settings.

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Feature Filtering (3).
Find the Sort Values By configuration (4), and find its value (5). Also, find the Sort Direction configuration (6), and find its value (7).
NOTE The Sort Values configuration (8) is also available, but applies only to the Product List page version 1.0.

The combination of the Sort Values By and Sort Direction configurations determine the sort behavior.

SORT VALUES BY	SORT DIRECTION	SPEC VALUE SORT BEHAVIOR
value	ASC	Alphabetical order
value	DESC	Reverse alphabetical order
count	ASC	By number of matching results, from least to most
count	DESC	By number of matching results, from most to least
If the current combination doesn't meet your needs, you can override the value of the Sort Values By setting.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Feature Filtering
Configuration	Sort Values By
Page	PLP
Value	value or count
If necessary, override the value of the Sort Direction setting.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Feature Filtering
Configuration	Sort Direction
Page	PLP
Value	ASC or DESC
